name: Gothia Towers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed only one night. The view from our room was the wall from the other side. Small rooms. The breakfast room was like a food court with lots of choices but not at all romantic. This hotel wasn't bad but nothing exceptional. The reastaurant is very high priced, but great view.
reviews.title: very average with bad view

reviews.text: Very comfortable, well positioned hotel I was on a business trip and stayed 8 days in this hotel on bed and breakfast, it was a very pleasant experience. It is a very modern 4* hotel, about 40 min bus drive from Landvetter airport. Buses are very well scheduled and go exactly on time (like every other transportation in Sweden). Hotel Gothia Towers is at bus first stop on Massans Gata square. Everything in the hotel is fantastically organized for business purposes (you can go through hotel lobby to Goteborg Convention center which was very convenient for me). Very professional and kind staff, high speed Internet in the rooms and in the lobby, business rooms with access 24/7 if you don't have a laptop or you need to print something. My room was located on the West towers 6th floor with lovely sight on the square, very clean, spacious, with everything you may need (even iron and iron board). Breakfast was the same every day, but with excellent choice of different meals. On the 23th floor is Haven restaurant, very modern, clean, food is excellent (obviously expensive), and it has a fantastic sight on the city of Goteborg. Cultural and shopping area and port of Goteborg is approximately 15-20 min walk from the hotel, you can use public transportation (exactly on time) from the square. Across the street from the hotel is Lieseberg amusement park, I regret for not seeing it due to my lectures, because in September it is open only Fri-Sun.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, well positioned hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 2008. I was in town attending an event at the nearby Scandinavium Arena so the hotel was in a perfect location for me.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Enjoyed our Stay
a great place to stay
reviews.text: The check in was a breeze and our room (standard twin) was ready way before the official check in time (3 pm). My room was on the 8th floor in the East Tower. It was small, clean yet the decor looked a little bit dated. So did the bathroom (shower only, no bathtub). Also, wired high speed Internet is available in all rooms free of charge.

We had breakfast (full American breakfast buffet including scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, sausages, all sorts of pastry, cheese, ham, etc.) included in our room rate and we're very satisfied with it.

likes.liked: — The view from the top floor.

reviews.text: The hotel offers buffet lunch in its lobby bar. Also, there's the Heaven 23 Restaurant and Bar in the West Tower. We had dinner over there one of the nights and got the best bowl of chicken salad ever.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: Overall, we had a very pleasant stay and would recommend the place, especially it's just a short walk to the Avenyn (Goteborg's main street), Gotegorg Convention Centre (next door), the Scandinavium (1 block away) and the Lisenberg Amusement Park and Universum (across the street).
reviews.title: Nice Good Value Hotel - Excellent Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel, the staff are amazingly friendly (like most people in the city) and the rooms are extremely clean. If you can get the buffet breakfast as eating in Gothenburg can be expensive but the hotel breakfast will fill you up nicely and has a fantastically wide range. Everything from cereal to caviar in a tube (don't...try...).
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: All in all it's location is bettered only by the service, if you need a base in Gothenburg you can do much much worse than this hotel.

reviews.text: I visited Gothenburg on 30th June 2008 and stayed at Gothia Towers for a week with my husband and had a lovely time in the hotel. It is very nice and clean, good facilities with 2 restaurants on site including 23 Heaven which has a lovely view of the city. Nice location with a little walk to the Avenue where all the shops and restaurants/bars are. Rooms are cleaned every day and towels changed if required. Huge selection of food for breakfast which is buffet style.

reviews.text: Only downside is the lift system you sometimes have to wait ages for your lift to come, not a major problem though. There is however a glass lift that comes lot quicker if your not too bothered about heights and gives you a fantastic view.

description: Gothia Towers is Sweden´s largest first-class hotel with 704 rooms and suites, and four public restaurants and bars.With our flexible 41,000 m² of space, we can offer you unique opportunities for conferences, congresses and banqueting – a perfect alternative for meetings of any size. Or why not the party of the year?Gothia Towers is located in central Gothenburg, right in the thick of things on Korsvägen, just a couple of blocks from the restaurants and nightclubs on fashionable Avenyn. We are close to the city centre with excellent transport links, right next to Scandinavia’s biggest amusement park Liseberg, Scandinavium and everything the entertainment district has to offer.Welcome!
